intro: Urostigma bengalense, commonly known as the Bengal urostigma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant contains latex, which can be toxic and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
